abstract: Performa 11, the visual art performance biennial, will present its first-ever Malcolm Award, named for the provocative punk-rock figure, to an artist who is 40 or younger and who has "demonstrated the most innovative and thought-provoking performance" in the event.

lead_paragraph: Throughout a creative career whose highlights included organizing the seminal punk-rock band Sex Pistols, and which ended with his being buried in a coffin that read, "Too Fast to Live, Too Young to Die," Malcolm McLaren was not necessarily concerned with how future generations - or current ones, for that matter - might regard him.

headline.main: New Arts Award Named for Malcolm McLaren
